title: Can relationships exist without respect and trust? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. And they are very common. Think about all of the relationships in life that fall into this category: The relationship one has with a school principal who unfairly criticizes a child. The relationship with a boss who has a bad temper and has held up a well-deserved promotion for the past five years. A relationship with a State Senator who doesn’t have the spine to stand up to an unpopular president. A relationship with a self-centered aunt who may typically only be thinking about herself. A relationship with a sibling who acts like a rival instead of a friend. A relationship with an ex who cheated but they are the parent of one or more of your children. Indeed, we often have relationships with people whom we neither respect nor trust. What all of these relationships have in common is that they are relationships of necessity. Many relationships exist without trust and respect. Want one more? Think about abusive husbands or wives. Does anyone question that neither trust nor respect are hallmarks of relationships like these?

Yes and No All relationships are based on mutual respect and trust. Parent and Child, Sibling and Another Sibling, Employer and Employee, Romantic Partners.. they are there because of mutual respect and trust. If either respect or trust is gone, I would think that the relationship between the two persons are merely “co-exitence” instead of an actual relationship. Such as, an employee stays with an employer because of financial needs instead of actually trusting and respecting the employer and the company. Hope this helps.

I believe that trust is the most important factor in a relationship … if I don’t trust a woman completely, how can I be certain she’s not going to tell my wife :-) Jimmy Carr ******************* All children abide in relationships with their parents/caregivers REGARDLESS of how those adults behave. They are stuck there because it’s all they have, and all they know. Sadly, children’s brains make two really big mistakes…..they: over-generalize — believe what is true in their family is true across the whole worldover-personalize — believe that what happens to them is their fault; not the responsibility of dysfunctional & wounded adultsThese early beliefs get consciously forgotten, but live on in the unconscious of the child and affect all future relationships until faced/changed through the hard work of introspection. Respect and Trust are big words. Once I read: “एक ही उसूल पर गुजारी है जिंदगी हमने, जिसे अपना समझा उसे कभी परखा नही”. (On one belief I've lived my life, to never test/judge anyone who is dear to me.) So when you trust someone, you really should do so. Because once that happens, nothing will separate both of you… Now, let's speak about respect, respect should be mutual towards each other. For example, your partner has grown up in a different environment, so we should respect our partner's culture, behaviour and atmosphere and try to adjust ourselves accordingly. We can't expect our partner to settle in a new atmosphere quickly. We must give sufficient time to our partner. Hence, Respect and Trust are Pillars for any Relationships.
